newsitem.title: INDIA: India to resume futures trade in cotton, jute.
newsitem.headline: India to resume futures trade in cotton, jute.

text.p: India said on Friday that it will resume futures trade in ginned, baled cotton and jute goods.
Finance Minister P. Chidambaram, while presenting the budget 1997/98 (April-March), said the country would also set up a global castor oil future exchange.
Earlier this month the Food Ministry said that the country's first International Pepper Futures Exchange and clearing house will start functioning in the southern state of Kerala, by April.
At present futures trading is allowed in castorseed, hessian, gur (jaggery), potatoes, turmeric and pepper.
